pr_title: Allow disabling the Swagger/GraphQL/Health/OpenAPI UIs at Runtime

timeline.bodyText: Is this class meant to be used outside the extension? Otherwise it would be nice to be marked as package-private to avoid being listed in https://quarkus.io/guides/all-builditems
timeline.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: Otherwise it would be nice to add some Javadoc to this class 👍
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: Nope this is for internal only, I'll change to package-private. Thanks :)
replies.author: phillip-kruger

timeline.bodyText: Maybe make the name more specific to the extension?
timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText:
I was thinking about this yesterday and my first inclination was to have expose defaulting to true.
Just a proposal, I don't know what's best really :).
timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText:
Between enable and deactivate, it's going to be a bit hard to guess what will be going on :).
I wonder if we should simply move this one to runtime and have something like:

alwaysInclude: defines if Swagger UI is included in the package or not
enable: defines if it's exposed or not. And this would be a runtime config.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: I initially just move enable to a runtime config. However, then you can not disable in dev and test mode. So I decided to allow you to deactivate, if included. Maybe it should change to deactivateIfIncluded ?
replies.author: phillip-kruger

replies.bodyText: Except if we say you can not disable in dev and test ? And then use disable to disable in runtime when included ?
replies.author: phillip-kruger

replies.bodyText:

This is my initial reaction to.

I wonder if we should simply move this one to runtime and have something like:

+1 on this.

I initially just move enable to a runtime config. However, then you can not disable in dev and test mode

Not sure I understood the issue but I think defining the enable=false property in the application.properties on a profile basis can fix it.
replies.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText: Ok, so if we just move enable to runtime, and alwaysInclude stay as is that is fine? Should I rename enable to expose ?
replies.author: phillip-kruger

replies.bodyText:
Ok, so if we just move enable to runtime, and alwaysInclude stay as is that is fine?

Yes, exactly.
alwaysInclude will only decide if we include the bits outside of dev mode
enable will allow to enable things and will be runtime. Obviously, it will only enable things if the bits are included.

Should I rename enable to expose ?

No, I would keep it as it is to avoid breaking compatibility for nothing. The expose idea was before I stumbled upon this enable knob.
As said by @machi1990 , I think profiles will allow to handle everything nicely.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Ok, let me update, I'll ping you once everything is changed
replies.author: phillip-kruger

timeline.bodyText: We tend to avoid that and prefer parameter injection. Otherwise you completely lose the dependencies.
timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText:
You should make this static and pass the parameters here.
In a perfect world, the config would also be injected in the build steps that require it.
timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText: So we always expose this one?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Yes, except that you can also disable in runtime, with the UI.
replies.author: phillip-kruger

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand this change? We certainly prefer having proper default values.
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -17,12 +19,7 @@
      * Always include the UI. By default this will only be included in dev and test.
      * Setting this to true will also include the UI in Prod
      */
-    @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "false")
-    boolean alwaysInclude;
+    @ConfigItem
+    Optional<Boolean> alwaysInclude;

replies.bodyText: That is the only way I could get it to work like it did before. The proper default value now is empty (not explicitly set by the user). That way I can still do the "include in dev and test" by default and "exclude" in prod by default. If the user set this explicitly, then I do not include at all everywhere (if false) or also include in prod (if true). Else there is no way to exclude in dev and test (i.e don't use this at all)
replies.author: phillip-kruger

timeline.author: gsmet
